medical_history.chief_complaint: 6 day history of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports sharp, intermittent RUQ pain following meals that has progressively worsened over 6 days. There are episodes of non-bloody emesis following meals and diarrhea. The patient denies episodes of subjective fever and respiratory symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic kidney disease (stage IV), chronic atrial fibrillation on anti-coagulation, hypertension, diastolic dysfunction, mild systolic dysfunction, rheumatic heart disease involving mitral valve (subsequent mild mitral stenosis and 2+ mitral regurgitation, aortic insufficiency), hypothyroidism, pulmonary hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died traumatically at age unspecified. Father died of stomach cancer at age unspecified. No brothers or sisters.
